Text.text: You can add custom subsections to existing sections in your Object Page application to display additional content within a structured layout.
Custom subsections allow you to extend standard sections with custom UI controls, visualizations, or third-party components while maintaining the Object Page's hierarchical structure.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: SubSection Configuration in Manifest
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Define your custom subsections in the manifest.json file under the 'content.body.sections.[sectionName].subSections' configuration. Each subsection references a fragment that contains the custom content.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Subsection Title
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Define subsection titles using i18n keys to support multiple languages. The title property in the subsection configuration references the i18n bundle.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Fragment Type Configuration
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Specify the fragment type as 'XMLFragment' in the subsection configuration to ensure proper loading and rendering of your custom content.

fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.title: Custom SubSection Fragment
fpmExplorer:ImplementationStep.text: Create a fragment that defines your custom subsection content. This example shows a flight map visualization using the VBM (Visual Business Map) control within a subsection.
